comment.text: Iodination and coupling of the hormonogenic tyrosines in thyroglobulin to yield the thyroid hormones T(3) and T(4).
Binds 1 heme b (iron(II)-protoporphyrin IX) group covalently per heterodimer.
Interacts with DUOX1, DUOX2 and CYBA.

isoform.name: TPO2
isoform.text: Lacks exon 10. Found in normal thyroid tissues as well as Graves'tissues. Rapidly degraded after synthesis, does not reach the cell surface. Inactive.

isoform.name: TPO3
Graves' disease
TPOzaninelli
isoform.text: Lacks exon 16. Found in normal thyroid tissues as well as Graves'tissues. Active.

isoform.name: TPO5
isoform.text: Lacks exon 8. Does not fold correctly. Does not reach the cell surface.

comment.text: Heme is covalently bound through a H(2)O(2)-dependent autocatalytic process. Heme insertion is important for the delivery of protein at the cell surface.
An alternative splicing in the thyroperoxidase mRNA can cause Graves' disease.

disease.name: Thyroid dyshormonogenesis 2A
disease.description: A disorder due to defective conversion of accumulated iodide to organically bound iodine. The iodide organification defect can be partial or complete.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.
Belongs to the peroxidase family. XPO subfamily.

feature.description: In isoform 2, isoform 2-3, isoform 2-4 and isoform 6.
In TDH2A; partial defect; expression slightly lower in efficiency and more degenerative than wild-type enzyme.
In TDH2A; partial defect; expressed on the plasma membrane surface at less than half the rate of wild-type enzyme.
In TDH2A; fails to localize to the plasma membrane; dbSNP:rs776742629.
In TDH2A; fails to localize to the plasma membrane; dbSNP:rs138931129.
